articles.author: Nick Ames
articles.title: Chelsea’s Graham Potter hails ‘special night’ after victory over Dortmund - The Guardian
articles.description: Graham Potter said: ‘The players have been suffering; today was important,’ while Borussia Dortmund’s Jude Bellingham was unhappy at the retaken penalty
articles.content: A relieved Graham Potter hailed a special night after his Chelsea side reached the Champions League quarter-finals with a 2-0 win against Borussia Dortmund, bringing up successive victories during a … [+3158 chars]

articles.author: Danny Milton
articles.title: MoonSwatch Mission To Moonshine Gold Photos - HODINKEE
articles.description: Well, it wasn't the solid-gold Swatch some were hoping for – but this collector had to have it anyway. Read on for coverage of the scenes in both Tokyo and London.
articles.content: The scene in London was no boring affair with queues (I know my local jargon) roughly 2,000 strong. Duck Kim was the lucky first in line and first to buy, having camped out overnight beginning at 4:3… [+200 chars]

articles.author: Neuroscience News
articles.title: Puzzle-Solving Behavior Spreads Through Bumblebee Colonies - Neuroscience News
articles.description: Bumblebees are able to learn to solve puzzles by watching more experienced bees complete a task. This new behavioral preference then spreads throughout the entire colony. The bees that learned from others became more adept and began to prefer the learned solu…
articles.content: Summary: Bumblebees are able to learn to solve puzzles by watching more experienced bees complete a task. This new behavioral preference then spreads throughout the entire colony. The bees that learn… [+4574 chars]

articles.author: Caitlin Tilley, Fiona Jackson
articles.title: Scientists develop hormone injection that halves the time to sober up - Daily Mail
articles.description: Fibroblast growth factor 21 (FGF21) - produced in the livers of people and animals - was shown to halve the time it took for mice to recover from alcohol, researchers from Texas found.
articles.content:
It's easy to take a night out one drink too far, but soon you might not need a drink of water and a walk around the block to reverse the signs of drunkenness. 
That's because scientists have develop… [+3886 chars]
